mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Pamela C. Golding to Colonel James Chesnut, 1861 April 25
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Golding, Pamela C.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from Pamela C. Golding to Colonel James Chesnut, April 25, 1861. Rosemont. Private. Written on behalf of Ann Pamela Cunningham - quite ill. Asks him to request Gen. Beauregard and President Davis of the Confederates information on whether war to be carried to Virginia soil. If so, she is anxious to remove to Mount Vernon since she feels her presence there will be Mount Vernon's greatest safeguard.
